0069172b-3501-4ce1-bc14-86e1197e21df.description: Earners apply and are selected for a competitive experience in serving as an advocate and ambassador for the national organization for a year-long term. They participate in training in marketing, time management, storytelling and inclusivity, in addition to attending a combination of in-person and virtual meetings with their teammates and professional staff. Earners contribute to the organizational growth on their college campus and influence their peers while exhibiting marketing skills.
0069172b-3501-4ce1-bc14-86e1197e21df.name: AFA Ambassador

issuer.summary: issued by Agriculture Future of America

badge_template_activities.title: Promote AFA programs on their college campus
Participate in in-person and virtual AFA Ambassador meetings
Participate in marketing, time management, storytelling and inclusivity trainings

6cba5a41-c2ac-4c66-aa1e-6860d0bfa247.description: In an effort to develop strong relationships, earners are able to approach uncomfortable conversations with curiosity, a desire to listen and by respecting the other person's point of view. As a result, they develop richer relationships with people and stronger teams. Session topics center around diversity, equity, inclusion and engagement in the food and agriculture industry. However, the earner's new skillset is transferable to any uncomfortable conversation.
6cba5a41-c2ac-4c66-aa1e-6860d0bfa247.name: AFA Bridge: thriving through our differences

issuer.summary: issued by Agriculture Future of America

badge_template_activities.title: Complete application and introductory conversation with AFA Staff
Attend a minimum of three weekly sessions

dc0619bc-bfd2-47e3-843e-cfff7603218f.description: Through a self-driven experience, earners are paired with dedicated coaches to achieve personal goals and develop professional skills that produce powerful, project-ready young leaders. Earners work towards competence in career-focused skills while articulating evidence of growth and progress towards their goals. The earner's development and new skillset will set them on a path to excel and lead in their career.
dc0619bc-bfd2-47e3-843e-cfff7603218f.name: AFA Leader Fellow

issuer.summary: issued by Agriculture Future of America

badge_template_activities.title: Apply and complete a self-assessment.
Identify and meet regularly with a trained AFA Leader Fellowship Coach.
Attend two AFA Leaders Conferences to be eligible for the program.

Complete a portfolio with evidence of growth toward the earner's goals, which may include skill development of AFA’s six competency areas - Relationship Development, Systems Thinking, Collaboration, Cultural EQ, Interpersonal IQ and Career Management.
Present final portfolio to personal board of directors in a capstone interview.

e0ecae49-9935-4af5-8f29-26a90341c2e4.description: Through various trainings and programs, earners learn and practice comprehensive, effective facilitation techniques and skills. Earners work on developing a solid preparation process and execute using inclusivity, flexibility and professionalism. The earner’s growth in this area will lead them to efficiently and thoughtfully bringing groups to consensus while making audiences feel comfortable in any program environment.
e0ecae49-9935-4af5-8f29-26a90341c2e4.name: AFA Student Advisor Facilitation Training

issuer.summary: issued by Agriculture Future of America

badge_template_activities.title: Complete general facilitation training
Complete room management and speaker engagement training
Facilitate discussion(s) and/or activities at least one AFA Leader Institute and the AFA Leaders Conference
Give and receive feedback on facilitation work related to hosting and facilitating at AFA programs

43dd2c02-a690-4e49-8f24-6db3ef743e3b.description: Through continuous training, earners complete various tasks with AFA staff to develop public speaking skills that creates engaging, confident speakers. Earners work on memorization, authenticity, emphatics, vocal variation, audience awareness, and connecting to a message as public speakers. The earner’s growth in this area will lead them to confidently conveying messages in front of audiences of various sizes as Student Advisors and in their lives outside of AFA.
43dd2c02-a690-4e49-8f24-6db3ef743e3b.name: AFA Student Advisor Public Speaking Training

issuer.summary: issued by Agriculture Future of America

badge_template_activities.title: Identify public speaking strengths, challenges, and growth goals with AFA staff member.
Memorize story tied to AFA’s mission.
Recite memorized story for AFA staff member.
Reflect on and receive feedback on effectiveness of recital of story.
Give and receive feedback on personal speaking work related to hosting and speaking at AFA programs.

e17435db-f373-45c5-be86-274dc03ce136.description: Earners apply and are selected for a highly-competitive experience in serving as the student voice for the national organization for a year-long term. They complete and participate in extensive trainings in inclusivity, facilitation, public speaking and customer service, in addition to meeting at least once per month with their teammates and professional staff. Earners contribute student voice and perspective to influence the collegiate programming and strategic direction of the organization.
e17435db-f373-45c5-be86-274dc03ce136.name: AFA Student Advisor

issuer.summary: issued by Agriculture Future of America

badge_template_activities.title: Host one AFA Leader Institute in 2021
Host one student delegate Track of the 2021 AFA Leaders Conference
Participate in inclusivity, facilitation, public speaking, and customer service trainings
Represent student voice on the AFA Board of Directors at two meetings

6376ba04-e83b-4938-b6fe-65b1cc8e17b4.description: Earners participate in extensive trainings in respect and inclusivity topics such as stereotypes, identities, unconscious bias, allyship and equity. After completing trainings, earners create an Inclusivity Proposal with their team by identifying and suggesting inclusive practices to implement at AFA Leaders Conference. The earner’s growth in this area will lead them to greater awareness of their own identities, biases and skills to ensure they contribute to inclusive environments.
6376ba04-e83b-4938-b6fe-65b1cc8e17b4.name: AFA Student Advisor Respect & Inclusivity Training

issuer.summary: issued by Agriculture Future of America

badge_template_activities.title: 18 hours of Respect and Inclusivity training with AFA staff and external trainers
Developed Inclusivity Proposal for the AFA Leaders Conference with the other Student Advisors
Completed Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI) individual assessment

bf7f7646-7343-4cab-b165-fd3b391cb5db.description: Through an individualized experience, earners are paired with students to achieve the student’s personal goals and develop the student’s professional skills to produce powerful, project-ready young leaders. Earners coach students toward competence in career-focused skills, while serving as a role model and mentor through the experience. The earner's enhanced skillset in relationship development as a coach and mentor sets them on a path to lead others with strength and competence in future work.
bf7f7646-7343-4cab-b165-fd3b391cb5db.name: AFA Leader Fellowship Coach

issuer.summary: issued by Agriculture Future of America

badge_template_activities.title: Appy and complete a self-assessment.
Identify and meet regularly with an enrolled AFA Leader Fellowship Candidate.
Provide coaching and support to student through meetings, shared resources, and goal development.

Support student growth towards their personal and professional goals, which may include skill development in AFA’s six competency areas — Relationship Development, Systems Thinking, Collaboration, Cultural EQ, Interpersonal IQ and Career Management.
Communicate with student’s personal board of directors to organize final presentation of portfolio and capstone interview.
